com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing

Class PImageIconAsync

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.ImageIcon
      • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing.PImageIconAsync
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Accessible, Icon
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PThemeImageIcon

    @FullyTested
public class PImageIconAsync
extends ImageIcon
    Extends ImageIcon to load images asynchronously (non-blocking). The JDK implementation, ImageIcon, blocks on construction. This version does not block on construction, but may block when any method from interface Icon is called:
    • getIconWidth()
    • getIconHeight()
    • paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int)

    Opportunites for blocking can be further reduced by setting the expected image dimensions with setExpectedDimension(PImmutableDimension). Before the image is done loading, getIconWidth() and getIconHeight() will return expected (instead of actual) image dimensions. This is important to prevent blocking during initial layout, trigger by Window.pack(). (Class Window is also inherited by class JFrame). The expected image dimensions are set automatically when using subclass PThemeImageIcon.

    In many cases, the time between construction and layout/paint is sufficiently long to load the image in a background thread. If insufficient, the image will block.

    Query the image load status with updateImageLoadStatus(), and wait for the image to finish loading with waitForLoad(long).

    To control whether or not exceptions are thrown if the image fails to load, call ignoreIconLoadErrors(boolean). By default, unchecked (runtime) exceptions are thrown.

    Expanding upon the base class, new constructors are available to load (i) from byte streams (InputStream) or (ii) from classpath resources embedded in a JAR.

    • PImageIconAsync(InputStream)
    • PImageIconAsync(InputStream, String) (with description)
    • PImageIconAsync(Class, String)
    • PImageIconAsync(Class, String, String) (with description)
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    ImageIcon, PThemeImageIcon, Serialized Form

      • PImageIconAsync

        public PImageIconAsync()
        This is a convenience constructor to call ImageIcon.ImageIcon().

      • PImageIconAsync

        public PImageIconAsync(InputStream in,
               String optDescription)
                throws IOException
        Reads all bytes from an InputStream, then calls PImageIconAsync(byte[], String).

        This constructor is not available in base class ImageIcon.

        Parameters:
        in - stream of bytes for image data
        optDescription - see ImageIcon.setDescription(String). May be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when reading stream
        See Also:
        PImageIconAsync(InputStream), PImageIconAsync(Class, String, String)

        Reads all bytes from an InputStream, then calls PImageIconAsync(byte[]).

        This constructor is not available in base class ImageIcon.

      • PImageIconAsync

        public PImageIconAsync(Class<?> clazz,
               String classResourcePathname,
               String optDescription)
                throws com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.exception.ClassResourceNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Finds a classpath resource by its path, creates an InputStream, then calls PImageIconAsync(InputStream, String). This constructor is useful is loading images from classpath resources embedded in a JAR.

        This constructor is not available in base class ImageIcon.

        Parameters:
        clazz - Class used to find resource
        classResourcePathname - path to class resource. Read more here: PathArgs.checkClassResourceAsStreamExists(Class, String, String)
        optDescription - see ImageIcon.setDescription(String). May be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or classResourcePathname is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if classResourcePathname is empty
        com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.exception.ClassResourceNotFoundException - if resource is not found
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when reading stream
        See Also:
        PImageIconAsync(Class, String)

      • loadImage

        Overrides:

      • getImageLoadStatus

        public int getImageLoadStatus()
        This is a convenience method to call getImageLoadStatusAsEnum() and return the integer value from PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.value.
        Overrides:
        getImageLoadStatus in class ImageIcon

      • getImageLoadStatusAsEnum

        public PMediaTrackerLoadStatus getImageLoadStatusAsEnum()
        This method return the last known image loading status. To update the status, call updateImageLoadStatus().
        Returns:
        never null
        • PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.INITIAL: if icon load has not yet started
        • PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.LOADING: if icon load has started, but not yet finished, loading
        • PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.ABORTED: considered failure by ignoreIconLoadErrors()
        • PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.ERRORED: also considered failure by ignoreIconLoadErrors()
        • PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.COMPLETE: considered successful by ignoreIconLoadErrors()
        See Also:
        getImageLoadStatus(), setImageLoadStatus(PMediaTrackerLoadStatus)

      • setImageLoadStatus

        protected void setImageLoadStatus(PMediaTrackerLoadStatus status)
        For subclasses to access members.
        See Also:
        getImageLoadStatus(), setImageLoadStatus(PMediaTrackerLoadStatus)

      • updateImageLoadStatus

        public PMediaTrackerLoadStatus updateImageLoadStatus()
        Updates and retrieves the image load status. To retrieve the last known status, call getImageLoadStatus(). For a blocking update on load status, call waitForLoad(long).
        Returns:
        see getImageLoadStatus()
        See Also:
        getImageLoadStatus(), setImageLoadStatus(PMediaTrackerLoadStatus), waitForLoad(long)

      • ignoreIconLoadErrors

        public boolean ignoreIconLoadErrors()
        Retrieves whether or not IllegalStateException is throws by paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int) if this icon fails to load.

        The default value is DEFAULT_IGNORE_ICON_LOAD_ERRORS.

        Returns:
        if true and this icon fails to load, paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int) will throw an exception
        See Also:
        ignoreIconLoadErrors(boolean), PThemeIconLoaderAbstract.ignoreIconLoadErrors()

      • ignoreIconLoadErrors

        public void ignoreIconLoadErrors(boolean flag)
        Sets whether or not IllegalStateException is throws by paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int) if this icon fails to load.

        The default value is DEFAULT_IGNORE_ICON_LOAD_ERRORS.

        Parameters:
        flag - if true and this icon fails to load, paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int) will throw an exception
        See Also:
        ignoreIconLoadErrors(), PThemeIconLoaderAbstract.ignoreIconLoadErrors(boolean)

      • getExpectedDimension

        public PImmutableDimension getExpectedDimension()
        Retrieves the expected number of pixels for image width and height. An image file may be stored in a directory called "32x32", so the expected dimension is 32x32. However, after loading, the actual size may be different.

        If this value is set before the image is done loading, methods getIconWidth() and getIconHeight() will not block.

        The default setting is null.

        Returns:
        may be null if unset
        See Also:
        setExpectedDimension(PImmutableDimension), getIconWidth(), getIconHeight()

      • setExpectedDimension

        public void setExpectedDimension(PImmutableDimension optDim)
        Sets the expected number of pixels for image width and height. An image file may be stored in a directory called "32x32", so the expected dimension is 32x32. However, after loading, the actual size may be different.

        If this value is set before the image is done loading, methods getIconWidth() and getIconHeight() will not block.

        The default setting is null.

        Parameters:
        optDim - optional expected number of pixels for image width and height. May be null
        See Also:
        getExpectedDimension(), getIconWidth(), getIconHeight()

      • waitForLoad

        public PMediaTrackerLoadStatus waitForLoad()
                                    throws InterruptedException
        This is a convenience method to call waitForLoad(long) where timeoutMillis is zero.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • waitForLoad

        public PMediaTrackerLoadStatus waitForLoad(long timeoutMillis)
                                    throws InterruptedException
        Waits for the image to finish loading. For a non-blocking update on load status, call updateImageLoadStatus().
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis -
        • maximum number of milliseconds to wait for image to load
        • if zero, the wait is unlimited
        Returns:
        see getImageLoadStatus()
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the load is interrupted
        See Also:
        waitForLoad(), updateImageLoadStatus(), getImageLoadStatus()

      • queryMediaTrackerForImageLoadStatus

        protected PMediaTrackerLoadStatus queryMediaTrackerForImageLoadStatus(MediaTracker mt)
        Retrieves and updates the latest image load status from a MediaTracker. If the load is complete (successful or not), (i) remove image from MediaTracker, (ii) update width and height, and (iii) clear the last media tracker id.
        Parameters:
        mt - reference to a MediaTracker to retrieve image load status update
        Returns:
        updated image load status; matches getImageLoadStatusAsEnum()
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mt is null
        See Also:
        updateImageLoadStatus(), waitForLoad(long)

      • paintIcon

        public void paintIcon(Component c,
             Graphics g,
             int x,
             int y)
        If ignoreIconLoadErrors() is true, and icon failed to load, throw an exception. Repeatedly calling this method may throw the same IllegalStateException.
        Docs from Icon.paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int):

        Specified by:
        paintIcon in interface Icon
        Overrides:
        paintIcon in class ImageIcon
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if ignoreIconLoadErrors() is true and any case below:
        • if waitForLoad() throws InterruptedException
        • if getImageLoadStatus() is not PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.COMPLETE
        • if getExpectedDimension() is not null and does not match actual loaded image dimensions
        See Also:
        checkImageLoadDone()

      • checkImageLoadDone

        protected void checkImageLoadDone()
        Call by all methods from interface Icon. This method will block if the image is not done loading.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if ignoreIconLoadErrors() is true and any case below:
        • if waitForLoad() throws InterruptedException
        • if getImageLoadStatus() is not PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.COMPLETE
        • if getExpectedDimension() is not null and does not match actual loaded image dimensions
        See Also:
        getIconWidth(), getIconHeight(), paintIcon(Component, Graphics, int, int)

      • getIconWidth

        public int getIconWidth()
        Optimised override to reduce blocking opportunities. If the expected dimensions were set with setExpectedDimension(PImmutableDimension), this method will not block before the image is done loading.
        Specified by:
        getIconWidth in interface Icon
        Overrides:
        getIconWidth in class ImageIcon
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if getExpectedDimension() is null, and if ignoreIconLoadErrors() is true, and any case below:
        • if waitForLoad() throws InterruptedException
        • if getImageLoadStatus() is not PMediaTrackerLoadStatus.COMPLETE
        See Also:
        setExpectedDimension(PImmutableDimension), checkImageLoadDone(), getIconHeight(), setIconWidth(int)

      • getIconWidthCore

        protected int getIconWidthCore()
        For subclasses to access members. Unlike getIconWidth(), this method is guaranteed not to block.
        See Also:
        getIconWidth(), getIconHeightCore()

      • getIconHeight

        public int getIconHeight()
        Optimised override to reduce blocking opportunities. If the expected dimensions were set with setExpectedDimension(PImmutableDimension), this method will not block before the image is done loading.

        Overrides:
